content.text: is designed to process account cancellations that span multiple billing periods. It moves data from the

. The procedure handles the distribution of billing amounts and energy usage across multiple periods, ensuring that the data is accurately represented in the summary table. It uses a cursor to iterate over records that span more than one billing period, calculates the distribution of amounts and usage, and inserts the processed data into the summary table.
The complexity level of this stored procedure is high due to the following reasons:
It involves multiple table interactions and data transformations.
It uses a cursor to iterate over records, which adds complexity and potential performance overhead.
It includes complex calculations for distributing billing amounts and energy usage across multiple periods.
It involves several custom functions and procedures for calculations and date determinations.
: The ID of the authenticated user executing the procedure.
: The sequence ID of the utility company.
: An output parameter used to indicate the status of the procedure execution (set to 9 initially and 0 upon successful completion).
: The procedure begins by setting the
to 9, indicating the start of the process.
is greater than 1, indicating spanned records.
is declared to iterate over records in
For each record, it fetches necessary details and calculates the distribution of billing amounts and energy usage across the spanned periods.
It uses custom functions to calculate percentages and determine dates for each period.
The procedure calculates the distribution of amounts and usage for
periods and inserts the results into
It processes the last period separately to ensure accurate distribution and avoid rounding errors.
: After processing all records, the cursor is closed and deallocated, and the
is set to 0, indicating successful completion.
: The use of a cursor can lead to performance issues, especially with large datasets, as it processes records one at a time.
: The procedure involves multiple calculations and function calls, which can be resource-intensive.
: Depending on the indexes available, the procedure results in table scans, affecting performance.
: The use of cursors and multiple table interactions may lead to concurrency issues if the tables are accessed by other processes simultaneously.
: The procedure lacks explicit error handling, which could lead to unhandled exceptions and incomplete data processing.
: As the dataset grows, the performance may degrade due to the cursor and complex calculations.
: The procedure relies on accurate calculations and date determinations; any errors in these functions could lead to incorrect data distribution.

CREATE PROCEDURE [ManualBill].[usp_ManualBilling_ProcessAccountCancellationSpanned]
	@BillingPeriod varchar(6),
	@authenticatedID int,
	@utilityCompany dbo.seqid,
	@Status int  OUTPUT      
   
 AS 
 begin
 --********************************************************************************
 --	Author: MOHAMMED BELARREM
 -- Description: Copy spanned cancelation records from UploadManualBillingAccountCancelation to UploadManualBillingAccountCancelationSummary
 --					thru UploadManualBillingCancellationTempSummarySpanned 
 --	Log: 
 --		Creation 02/10/2009
 --		Update   02/11/2009	Updated the tables and needes to reflect changes 
 --		Update   12/29/2009	Updated the tables and needes to reflect changes, I've reduced the tables to essential data 
 --		Update   01/07/2010	Updated the quieres to be IBG independant 
 --		Update	 01/13/2010	Updated the tables with accountseqid
 --		Update	 12/17/2010	Updated the pasrsing initial load query to join by accountseqid
 --							since some of the utilities recylce accounts.
 --							central hudson accounts caused a bug because 2 of the accounts when they recycled the acccounts and the previous number was 
 --							bimonthly so the query picked up B as cycle and produced wrong results 
 --    update    12/17/2018 VY updated for UniqueAccountSeqID
 --********************************************************************************
	 
		/*****************************************************
		Declarations
		******************************************************/
		-- cursor
		declare @UploadCancellationTempSummarySpannedSeqid dbo.seqid
		
		-- spanned record information
		declare @IBGSeqid							dbo.seqid	
		declare @AccountmanualBillingHeaderSeqid	dbo.seqid
		declare @AccountSeqid						dbo.seqid	
		declare @OriginalAccountNumber				dbo.acctnum			
		declare @BillingPeriodRevision				dbo.yyyymm			
		declare @FirstBillingPeriodCanceled			dbo.yyyymm						
		declare @DeltaNumberOfPeriods				dbo.Accumulator			
		declare @CancelFromDate						dbo.yyyymmdd						
		declare @CancelToDate						dbo.yyyymmdd		
		declare @CancelBillingPeriodDays			dbo.BillingPeriodDays			
		declare @CancelNetBilledAmount				dbo.BillingAmt			
		declare @EnergySource						dbo.EnergySource			
		declare @CancelEnergyUsage					dbo.EnergyUnit			
		declare @CancelDemandUsage					dbo.Kilowatts			
		declare @BillingCycle						dbo.MonthlyBillingCycle	
		declare @TripNumber							dbo.TripNumber
		declare @NumberOfPeriodsMinusOne			int
		declare @TotalXXXSpannedBilledPercentage	dbo.DiscountPercentage
		declare @ApplyMonthlyPercentage				dbo.DiscountPercentage
		
		declare @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision		dbo.yyyymm
		declare @CalculatedFromDate						dbo.yyyymmdd
		declare @CalculatedToDate						dbo.yyyymmdd
		declare @idx									int
		declare @CancelNetBilledAmountMonthlySum		dbo.BillingAmt
		declare @CancelEnergyMonthlySum					dbo.EnergyUnit
		declare @CancelDemandMonthlySum					dbo.Kilowatts
		declare @CancelNetBilledAmountMonthly			dbo.BillingAmt
		declare @CancelEnergyMonthly					dbo.EnergyUnit
		declare @CancelDemandMonthly					dbo.Kilowatts
		declare @CancelNetBilledAmountLastPeriod		dbo.BillingAmt
		declare @CancelEnergyLastPeriod					dbo.EnergyUnit
		declare @CancelDemandLastPeriod					dbo.Kilowatts
		
		declare @Notes	dbo.notes
	
 		-- 
 		set @Status = 9

		/**************************
		1. Move data into the upload spanned table
		***************************/
		INSERT INTO [ManualBill].[UploadManualBillingCancellationTempSummarySpanned]
			   ([title]
			   ,[UtilityCompanySeqid]
			   ,[InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid]
			   ,[AccountmanualBillingHeaderSeqid]
			   ,AccountSeqid
			   ,UniqueAccountSeqID /* added on 12/17/2018*/
			   ,[OriginalAccountNumber]
			   ,[BillingPeriod]
			   ,[BillingPeriodRevision]
			   ,[FirstBillingPeriodCanceled]
			   ,[DeltaNumberOfPeriods]
			   ,[CancelFromDate]
			   ,[CancelToDate]
			   ,[CancelBillingPeriodDays]
			   ,[CancelNetBilledAmount]
			   ,[CancelEnergy]
			   ,[CancelDemand]
			   ,[EnergySource]
			   )
		select 
			    'SpannedCancellation' 				---	[title]
			   ,UtilityCompanySeqid					---	[UtilityCompanySeqid]
			   ,InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid		---	[InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid]
			   ,AccountManualBillingHeaderSeqid		---	[AccountmanualBillingHeaderSeqid]
			   ,AccountSeqid						--- [AccountSeqid]
			   ,UniqueAccountSeqid                  --- [UniqueAccountSeqid] /* added on 12/17/2018*/
			   ,OriginalAccountNumber				---	[OriginalAccountNumber]
			   ,BillingPeriod						---	[BillingPeriod]
			   ,BillingPeriodRevision				---	[BillingPeriodRevision]
			   ,FirstBillingPeriodCanceled			---	[FirstBillingPeriodCanceled]
			   ,DeltaNumberOfPeriods				---	[DeltaNumberOfPeriods]
			   ,FromDate							---	[CancelFromDate]
			   ,ToDate								---	[CancelToDate]
			   ,BillingPeriodDays					---	[CancelBillingPeriodDays]
			   ,NetBilledAmount						---	[CancelNetBilledAmount]
			   ,EnergyUsage							---	[CancelEnergy]
			   ,DemandUsage							---	[CancelDemand]
			   ,EnergySource						---	[EnergySource]
		FROM ManualBill.UploadManualBillingCancellation
		WHERE  ( DeltaNumberOfPeriods > 1 )
													
	
	
		

		/*******************************
		2. Parse spanned billed upload account cancellation info
		*********************************/
		--	DECLARE a cursor to get all account bills that span more than one period.( should be all records in UploadManualBillingCancellationTempSummarySpanned )
		DECLARE SpannedBillCursor CURSOR FOR
		SELECT UploadManualBillingCancellationTempSummarySpannedSeqid FROM ManualBill.UploadManualBillingCancellationTempSummarySpanned
		

		OPEN SpannedBillCursor;

		FETCH NEXT FROM SpannedBillCursor INTO @UploadCancellationTempSummarySpannedSeqid
		--
		-- Check @@FETCH_STATUS to see if there are any more rows to fetch.
		--
		WHILE @@FETCH_STATUS = 0
		BEGIN -- begin processing for fetched record
					
				--
				-- 2.1. Process n-1 spanned periods
				--
			
				select 
						@AccountmanualBillingHeaderSeqid	= Spanned.AccountmanualBillingHeaderSeqid 
					   ,@IBGSeqid							= Spanned.InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid
					   ,@AccountSeqid						= Spanned.AccountSeqid	
					   ,@OriginalAccountNumber				= Spanned.OriginalAccountNumber 
					   ,@BillingPeriodRevision				= Spanned.BillingPeriodRevision 
					   ,@FirstBillingPeriodCanceled			= Spanned.FirstBillingPeriodCanceled 	
					   ,@DeltaNumberOfPeriods				= Spanned.DeltaNumberOfPeriods 
					   ,@CancelFromDate 					= Spanned.CancelFromDate 
					   ,@CancelToDate 						= Spanned.CancelToDate 
					   ,@CancelBillingPeriodDays 			= Spanned.CancelBillingPeriodDays 
					   ,@CancelNetBilledAmount 				= Spanned.CancelNetBilledAmount 
					   ,@CancelEnergyUsage					= Spanned.CancelEnergy 
					   ,@CancelDemandUsage					= Spanned.CancelDemand 
					   ,@EnergySource 						= Spanned.EnergySource 
					   ,@BillingCycle						= Billing.Account.BillingCycle
					   ,@TripNumber							= Billing.Account.TripNumber
				from ManualBill.UploadManualBillingCancellationTempSummarySpanned as Spanned inner join Billing.Account on
					--spanned.OriginalAccountNumber = Billing.Account.OriginalAccountNumber AND Billing.Account.AccountSeqid = Spanned.AccountSeqid /* Comment out on 1/18/2019 */
					Billing.Account.UniqueAccountSeqid = Spanned.UniqueAccountSeqid  and Billing.Account.IsCurrentRecord = 'Y' /* added on 1/18/2019 */
				where ( UploadManualBillingCancellationTempSummarySpannedSeqid = @UploadCancellationTempSummarySpannedSeqid )
				
				
				/*
					 Distribute over spanned based on given percentage
				*/

				-- 2.1 periodAggregate the average City wide monthly energy usage percentage for the spanned row billing periods 
				select @TotalXXXSpannedBilledPercentage =[ManualBill].[CalculateTotalXXXSpannedBilledPercentage] (@BillingCycle,@DeltaNumberOfPeriods,@FirstBillingPeriodCanceled,@BillingPeriodRevision,@EnergySource )
					
				-- 2.2 Determine the number of periods minus 1 to pro-rate the money and usage.  The last period will derive the money and usage
				--	by row totals - (the n-1 aggregates of money and usage)
				set @NumberOfPeriodsMinusOne = @DeltaNumberOfPeriods-1


				--
				--	2.3 Initialize the counters for the n-1 parses
				--
				set @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision	= @FirstBillingPeriodCanceled 
				set @CalculatedFromDate					= @CancelFromDate 
				set @CalculatedToDate					= @CancelToDate 
				set @idx								= 0 
				set @CancelNetBilledAmountMonthlySum	= 0.00 
				set @CancelEnergyMonthlySum				= 0  
				set @CancelDemandMonthlySum				= 0  
				--
				
				--- 2.4 distribute / parse
				while (@NumberOfPeriodsMinusOne > @idx)
				Begin 

						-- 2.4.1 set value for required variables

						-- The @ApplyMonthlyPercentage holds the weigthed average for the particular month
						select @ApplyMonthlyPercentage = [ManualBill].[CalculateApplyMonthlyPercentageXXXSpannedBilled] (@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,@TotalXXXSpannedBilledPercentage, @EnergySource)

						--
						-- Apply the Monthly Percentage to the CCF,Therms and Billed Amount 
						--
						set @CancelNetBilledAmountMonthly	= ROUND(@CancelNetBilledAmount * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,2)
						set @CancelEnergyMonthly			= ROUND(@CancelEnergyUsage * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,0)
		/*REVISE*/		set @CancelDemandMonthly			= ROUND(@CancelDemandUsage * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,2)
						
						
						--
						-- Accululate the weigthed average units.
						--
						set @CancelNetBilledAmountMonthlySum	= @CancelNetBilledAmountMonthlySum + @CancelNetBilledAmountMonthly
						set @CancelEnergyMonthlySum				= @CancelEnergyMonthlySum + @CancelEnergyMonthly
						set @CancelDemandMonthlySum				= @CancelDemandMonthlySum + @CancelDemandMonthly
						
						
						
						
						--  
						--	The Billing Period Projected "ToDate" is derived from the table "dbo.BillingPeriodProjected" using the utility company seqid and the
						--	RevisedBillingPeriod and using the "EndofPeriodTodate" as the derived "Todate" for the account.
						--
						select @CalculatedToDate = ManualBill.DeterminActualDate(@OriginalAccountNumber, 'T', @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, @BillingCycle)

						if(@CalculatedToDate is null)
							select @CalculatedToDate = ManualBill.DetermineProjectedToOrFromDate(@utilityCompany, @IBGSeqid, @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, 'T', @tripNumber,  @BillingCycle	) 
						
							-- if both above methods fail prorate
						if(@CalculatedToDate is null)
							select @CalculatedToDate = ManualBill.ProRateToOrFromDate('T', @BillingCycle, @CancelFromDate, @CancelToDate, @idx, @DeltaNumberOfPeriods  )

						-- 2.4.2	Create a custom note that explains how the information was parsed and what was the original information of the spanned row.
						--	It will note in EC3 that the transaction was derived.
						select @Notes = SUBSTRING( cast(@DeltaNumberOfPeriods as varchar(6))+ ' First: '+@FirstBillingPeriodCanceled +' ( '+@CancelFromDate+') Last: '+ 
						@BillingPeriodRevision +' ( '+@CancelFromDate+'). '+' period: '+@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision+ ' Month %: '+cast(@ApplyMonthlyPercentage as varchar(10))+
						' - Total %: '+cast(@TotalXXXSpannedBilledPercentage as varchar(10)), 1, 300)

						--
						-- 2.4.3  INSERT the data into the summary table
						--		
						INSERT INTO ManualBill.[UploadManualBillingCancellationSummary]
							   ([UtilityCompanySeqid]
							   ,[InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid]
							   ,[AccountManualBillingHeaderSeqid]
							   ,[AccountSeqid]
							   ,[UniqueAccountSeqid] /* added on 12/17/2018 */
							   ,[OriginalAccountNumber]
							   ,[NumberOfTransactions]
							   ,[NumberOfRebillTransactions]
							   ,[NumberOfCancelTransactions]
							   ,[BillingPeriod]
							   ,[BillingPeriodRevision]
							   ,[ActualOrEstimated]
							   ,[CancelFromDate]
							   ,[CancelToDate]
							   ,[CancelBillingDays]
							   ,[CancelNetBilledAmount]
							   ,[CancelEnergyUsage]
							   ,[CancelDemandUsage]
							   ,[EnergySource]
							   ,[DerivedFromSpannedBill]
							   ,[SpannedCancelFromDate]
							   ,[SpannedCancelToDate]
							   ,[SpannedCancelBillingDays]
							   ,[SpannedCancelBillingPeriodRevision]
							   ,[SpannedCancelFirstBillingPeriodCanceled]
							   ,[SpannedCancelNetBilledAmount]
							   ,[SpannedCancelEnergy]
							   ,[SpannedCancelDemand]
							   ,[SpannedMonthlyPercentage]
							   ,[SpannedTotalPercentage]
							   ,[Notes]
							   ,[AuthenticatedUserID]
							   ,[DateAdded]
							   ,[LastUpdate])

						select 
								@utilityCompany								---	[UtilityCompanySeqid]
							   ,InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid				---	[InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid]
							   ,AccountmanualBillingHeaderSeqid				---	[AccountManualBillingHeaderSeqid]
							   ,AccountSeqid								--- [AccountSeqid]
							   ,UniqueAccountSeqId                          --- [UniqueAccountSeqid] /* added on 12/17/2018 */
							   ,OriginalAccountNumber						---	[OriginalAccountNumber]
							   ,1											---	[NumberOfTransactions]
							   ,0											---	[NumberOfRebillTransactions]
							   ,1											---	[NumberOfCancelTransactions]
							   ,BillingPeriod								---	[BillingPeriod]
							   ,@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision			---	[BillingPeriodRevision]
			/*REVISE*/		   ,null										---	[ActualOrEstimated]
							   ,@CalculatedFromDate							---	[CancelFromDate]
							   ,@CalculatedToDate							---	[CancelToDate]
							   ,dbo.CalculateNumberOfBillingDays(@CalculatedFromDate, @CalculatedToDate)							---	[CancelBillingDays]
							   ,@CancelNetBilledAmountMonthly				---	[CanceledNetBilledAmount]
							   ,@CancelEnergyMonthly						---	[CancelEnergyUsage]
							   ,@CancelDemandMonthly						---	[CancelDemandUsage]
							   ,@EnergySource								---	[EnergySource]
							   ,'Y'											---	[DerivedFromSpannedBill]
							   ,@CancelFromDate								---	[SpannedCancelFromDate]
							   ,@CancelToDate								---	[SpannedCancelToDate]
							   ,@CancelBillingPeriodDays					---	[SpannedCancelBillingDays]
							   ,@BillingPeriodRevision						---	[SpannedCancelBillingPeriodRevision]
							   ,@FirstBillingPeriodCanceled					---	[SpannedCancelFirstBillingPeriodCanceled]
							   ,@CancelNetBilledAmount						---	[SpannedCancelNetBilledAmount]
							   ,@CancelEnergyUsage							---	[SpannedCancelEnergy]
							   ,@CancelDemandUsage							---	[SpannedCancelDemand]
							   ,@ApplyMonthlyPercentage						---	[SpannedMonthlyPercentage]
							   ,@TotalXXXSpannedBilledPercentage			---	[SpannedTotalPercentage]
							   ,@Notes										---	[Notes]
							   ,@authenticatedID							---	[AuthenticatedUserID]
							   ,getdate()									---	[DateAdded]
							   ,getdate()									---	[LastUpdate]
																		
						from ManualBill.UploadManualBillingCancellationTempSummarySpanned 
						where ( UploadManualBillingCancellationTempSummarySpannedSeqid = @UploadCancellationTempSummarySpannedSeqid )
											

						--
						--	Calculate the next the Revised Billing Period row.
						select @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision = [dbo].[CalculateNextBillingPeriod]  (@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,@BillingCycle)
						--	This will derive the new Revised Billing Period row's "FromDate"
						
						select @CalculatedToDate = ManualBill.DeterminActualDate(@OriginalAccountNumber, 'T', @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, @BillingCycle)

						if(@CalculatedToDate is null)
							select @CalculatedToDate = ManualBill.DetermineProjectedToOrFromDate(@utilityCompany, @IBGSeqid, @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, 'T', @tripNumber,  @BillingCycle	) 

							-- if both above methods fail prorate
						if(@CalculatedToDate is null)
							select @CalculatedToDate = ManualBill.ProRateToOrFromDate('T', @BillingCycle, @CancelFromDate, @CancelToDate, @idx, @DeltaNumberOfPeriods  )



						set @idx = @idx + 1
				end -- end distribute/parse


				--
				-- 2.2. Process the last spanned period
				--


				--	Use the (Nth -1) periods @CalculatedToDate as the "FromDate" and the acutal "ToDate" from the spanned record as the "ToDate"
				--
				select @CalculatedFromDate = ManualBill.DeterminActualDate(@OriginalAccountNumber, 'F', @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, @BillingCycle)

				if(@CalculatedFromDate is null)
					select @CalculatedFromDate = ManualBill.DetermineProjectedToOrFromDate(@utilityCompany, @IBGSeqid, @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, 'F', @tripNumber,  @BillingCycle	) 

					-- if both above methods fail prorate
				if(@CalculatedFromDate is null)
					select @CalculatedFromDate = ManualBill.ProRateToOrFromDate('F', @BillingCycle, @CancelFromDate, @CancelToDate, @idx, @DeltaNumberOfPeriods  )


				select @CalculatedToDate = @CancelToDate
				--
				--	@ApplyMonthlyPercentage is used for the notes purposes only
				--
				select @ApplyMonthlyPercentage = [ManualBill].[CalculateApplyMonthlyPercentageXXXSpannedBilled] (@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,@TotalXXXSpannedBilledPercentage, @EnergySource)
				--
				--	Derive the net changes to avoid rounding errors
				--
				set @CancelNetBilledAmountLastPeriod	= @CancelNetBilledAmount - @CancelNetBilledAmountMonthlySum
				set @CancelEnergyLastPeriod			= @CancelEnergyUsage - @CancelEnergyMonthlySum
				set @CancelDemandLastPeriod			= @CancelDemandUsage - @CancelDemandMonthlySum

				--
				--	Create a custom note that explains how the information was parsed and what was the original information of the spanned row.
				--	It will note in EC3 that the transaction was derived.
				--
				select @Notes = SUBSTRING(cast(@DeltaNumberOfPeriods as varchar(6))+' First: ' + @FirstBillingPeriodCanceled + ' ( ' + @CancelFromDate + ') Last: ' + 
				@BillingPeriodRevision +' ( ' + @CancelFromDate + '). ' + ' period: ' + @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision + ' Month %: ' + cast(@ApplyMonthlyPercentage as varchar(10))+
				' - Total %: ' + cast(@TotalXXXSpannedBilledPercentage as varchar(10)), 1, 300)	





				INSERT INTO [ManualBill].[UploadManualBillingCancellationSummary]
					   ([UtilityCompanySeqid]
					   ,[InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid]
					   ,[AccountManualBillingHeaderSeqid]
					   ,[AccountSeqid]
					   ,[UniqueAccountSeqid] /* added on 12/17/2018 */
					   ,[OriginalAccountNumber]
					   ,[NumberOfTransactions]
					   ,[NumberOfRebillTransactions]
					   ,[NumberOfCancelTransactions]
					   ,[BillingPeriod]
					   ,[BillingPeriodRevision]
					   ,[ActualOrEstimated]
					   ,[CancelFromDate]
					   ,[CancelToDate]
					   ,[CancelBillingDays]
					   ,[CancelNetBilledAmount]
					   ,[CancelEnergyUsage]
					   ,[CancelDemandUsage]
					   ,[EnergySource]
					   ,[DerivedFromSpannedBill]
					   ,[SpannedCancelFromDate]
					   ,[SpannedCancelToDate]
					   ,[SpannedCancelBillingDays]
					   ,[SpannedCancelBillingPeriodRevision]
					   ,[SpannedCancelFirstBillingPeriodCanceled]
					   ,[SpannedCancelNetBilledAmount]
					   ,[SpannedCancelEnergy]
					   ,[SpannedCancelDemand]
					   ,[SpannedMonthlyPercentage]
					   ,[SpannedTotalPercentage]
					   ,[Notes]
					   ,[AuthenticatedUserID]
					   ,[DateAdded]
					   ,[LastUpdate])

				select 
						@utilityCompany						---	[UtilityCompanySeqid]
					   ,InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid		---	[InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid]
					   ,AccountmanualBillingHeaderSeqid		---	[AccountManualBillingHeaderSeqid]
					   ,AccountSeqid						--- [AccountSeqid]
					   ,UniqueAccountSeqid                  --- [UniqueAccountSeqid] /* added on 12/17/2018 */
					   ,OriginalAccountNumber				---	[OriginalAccountNumber]
					   ,1									---	[NumberOfTransactions]
					   ,0									---	[NumberOfRebillTransactions]
					   ,1									---	[NumberOfCancelTransactions]
					   ,BillingPeriod						---	[BillingPeriod]
					   ,@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision	---	[BillingPeriodRevision]
	/*REVISE*/		   ,null								---	[ActualOrEstimated]
					   ,@CalculatedFromDate					---	[CancelFromDate]
					   ,@CalculatedToDate					---	[CancelToDate]
					   ,dbo.CalculateNumberOfBillingDays(@CalculatedFromDate, @CalculatedToDate)							---	[CancelBillingDays]
					   ,@CancelNetBilledAmountLastPeriod	---	[CanceledNetBilledAmount]
					   ,@CancelEnergyLastPeriod				---	[CancelEnergyUsage]
					   ,@CancelDemandLastPeriod				---	[CancelDemandUsage]
					   ,@EnergySource						---	[EnergySource]
					   ,'Y'									---	[DerivedFromSpannedBill]
					   ,@CancelFromDate						---	[SpannedCancelFromDate]
					   ,@CancelToDate						---	[SpannedCancelToDate]
					   ,@CancelBillingPeriodDays			---	[SpannedCancelBillingDays]
					   ,@BillingPeriodRevision				---	[SpannedCancelBillingPeriodRevision]
					   ,@FirstBillingPeriodCanceled			---	[SpannedCancelFirstCanceledBillingPeriod]
					   ,@CancelNetBilledAmount				---	[SpannedCancelNetBilledAmount]
					   ,@CancelEnergyUsage					---	[SpannedCancelEnergy]
					   ,@CancelDemandUsage					---	[SpannedCancelDemand]
					   ,@ApplyMonthlyPercentage				---	[SpannedMonthlyPercentage]
					   ,@TotalXXXSpannedBilledPercentage	---	[SpannedTotalPercentage]
					   ,@Notes								---	[Notes]
					   ,@authenticatedID					---	[AuthenticatedUserID]
					   ,getdate()							---	[DateAdded]
					   ,getdate()							---	[LastUpdate]
																
				from ManualBill.UploadManualBillingCancellationTempSummarySpanned 
				where ( UploadManualBillingCancellationTempSummarySpannedSeqid = @UploadCancellationTempSummarySpannedSeqid )



		 
				--	Process the next row
				--
				FETCH NEXT FROM SpannedBillCursor INTO @UploadCancellationTempSummarySpannedSeqid
		End -- end processing for fetched record

		CLOSE SpannedBillCursor; -- close cursor
		DEALLOCATE SpannedBillCursor;

 
		set @Status = 0
 
 
 end
